Name: The Good, The Bad and the Ugni
Ingredients: 10 ml Green Chartreuse (or alternative herbal liqueur)
Instructions: SHAKE first 3 ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass (preferably block of ice). Lastly, FLOAT Chartreuse.
Review: Perhaps it's the holier-than-thou Chartreuse that is playing the part of the bad guy in this tasty drink. The cognac (made with Ugni Blanc grapes) play the strong, characterful part.
History: Adapted from a recipe created in 2015 by Alex Mills at Lab 22 in Cardiff, Wales. Alex's original recipe calls for Martell Cordon Bleu.
Nutrition: One serving of The Good, The Bad and the Ugni contains 180 calories
